answer_4.text: During his presidency, Abraham Lincoln achieved significant legislative milestones, particularly with the Emancipation Proclamation and efforts to preserve the Union. The Emancipation Proclamation, issued on January 1, 1863, declared the freedom of all enslaved people in Confederate-held territory, redefining the Civil War's purpose to include the abolition of slavery. Additionally, Lincoln championed the passage of the Thirteenth Amendment, which abolished slavery in the United States, ratified in December 1865.
